comments:
To reproduce problem:
1) Start Eclipse
2) open the following dialog from the Run menu:
     Run > External Tools > External Tools...
3) Note that the Run button on the dialog is active without any choices 
available.  Clicking the Run button causes Eclipse to crash.

The following log information is produced:

Note that this problem does not happen on Windows (only Linux from what we've 
seen).  I suggest this is a P1 or P2 since it causes Eclipse to exit and 
potentially lose unsaved changes.

fixed in LaunchConfigurationsDialog.
When the button is created, set its enablement to false. When a valid config is selected the enablement will 
be updated.
*** Bug 97359 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 100687 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
